33 
34  // Hold-over from previous version that caches the residual terms instead of over-writing what's in vector_vars.
35  // This approach was abandoned because it caused a 20% decrease in speed.
36  // Method to apply the residuals stored in the temporary vectors to the FEEvaluation objects
37  //void apply_residuals();
38

40  void reinit_and_eval(const std::vector<vectorType*> &src, unsigned int cell);

42 
43  // Only initialize the FEEvaluation object for each variable (used for post-processing)

45

50  // The quadrature point index, a method to get the number of quadrature points per cell, and a method to get the xyz coordinates for the quadrature point
51  unsigned int q_point;
52  unsigned int get_num_q_points();

54

56  void get_JxW(dealii::AlignedVector<T> & JxW);
57

59  // The number of variables
60  unsigned int num_var;
61 
62  // Vectors of the actual FEEvaluation objects for each active variable, split into scalar variables and vector variables for type reasons
63  std::vector<dealii::FEEvaluation<dim,degree,degree+1,1,double> > scalar_vars;
64  std::vector<dealii::FEEvaluation<dim,degree,degree+1,dim,double> > vector_vars;
65 
66  // Object containing some information about each variable (indices, whether the val/grad/hess is needed, etc)
67  std::vector<variable_info> varInfoList;
68 
69  // Vectors to hold the residuals temporarily until they are applied to scalar_vars and vector_vars
70  // These are needed so that the "set" calls don't over-write the values in scalar_vars and vector_vars until after the call to residualRHS/residualLHS/postProcessedFields
71  std::vector<int> scalar_value_index;
72  std::vector<int> scalar_gradient_index;
73  std::vector<int> vector_value_index;
